a.n: Motor Music Jazz - Charles Gayle Trio

p.k: Born in the United States, Charles Gayle came to prominence in the 1990s. Gayle mostly plays free jazz on the saxophone, his main instrument, but he knows his way around the piano, bass clarinet, bass, and percussion too.
p.d: Charles Gayle was born in the United States. Gayle came to prominence in the 1990s after a few decades of obscurity, resulting from him living as a homeless man playing in New York City's streets and subways. Although the saxophone is his main instrument, free-jazz man Gayle also plays the piano, bass clarinet, bass, and percussion instrument. Together with Manolo Cabras on bass and Giovanni Barcella on drums, Charles Gayle performs at The MotorMusic Jazz Sessions.
